channel.title: Ways of studying
channel.description:
Tell me what you do to study for School or work. I read through my Biology and Geography books and take notes the whole Study Skills class.
It doesn't matter what subject, just tell me what class and how you study.

item.title: Ways of studying
item.dc:creator: @F_A_I_L_S Fails
item.description:
@F_A_I_L_S wrote:

A decent education. I win.

Read full topic

item.title: Ways of studying
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:2, topic:459562”][quote author=wildskiller link=topic=562389.msg4101165#msg4101165 date=1347498037]

dont look at it as studying. Look at it as doing something for a reward. Like…tell yourself your going to get the ice cream sandwich if you pass the test on Friday in math. etc

Hmm, well I find it enjoyable to study because I’m a nerd :D. I don’t think I’m getting anything out of it besides credits, which I get after passing the class.
[/quote]then make the credit your reward even though if you ask me that’s a sorry reward.

I just posted on mopar! yay reward time. goes to the fridge[/quote]

LOL
What else can I get out of it?

Read full topic

item.title: Ways of studying
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

throughout college and high school I would write notes in class then at home I would type them up, I never actually did anything with the type notes just taking the time of typing and proof reading my handwritten notes seemed to help me commit the details to memory.

Read full topic

item.title: Ways of studying
item.dc:creator: @F_A_I_L_S Fails
item.description:
@F_A_I_L_S wrote:

Math:

  • I create flashcards for the ‘topic’ we’re learning at that point in time. For example: Dividing Polynomials. I will put multiple problems on flash cards and work them.

History:

  • I usually skim the chapter we are going over and write down the important facts and whatnot.

English:

  • Seeing as I only have quizzes over Greek prefixes, I make flash cards and go over them multiple times.

Welding:

  • I practice running beads in my family garage.

That’s pretty much it. Sorry I didn’t explain in detail.

Read full topic

item.title: Ways of studying
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

the elve age:

Depends what you’re studying for. For calculus you do the homework every night, and review each night. Biology read the book and vocalize flash cards.

Edited post.

Read full topic
